metadata.title: へ (e) vs に (ni) for Direction

sections.heading: Basic Difference
sections.content:
に = specific destination (concrete point) へ = direction/orientation (abstract path)

東京に行く - "go to Tokyo" (destination focus) 東京へ行く - "go toward Tokyo" (direction focus)

sections.heading: In Most Cases: Interchangeable
sections.content:
For basic sentences about going places, both work:

学校に行く ✓ 学校へ行く ✓ Both mean "go to school" 日本に来る ✓ 日本へ来る ✓ Both mean "come to Japan"

children.heading: Specific point arrival
children.content: 駅に着く - "arrive at station" (へに着く sounds odd) 家に帰る - "return home" (に more common for 帰る)

children.heading: Attaching/entering
children.content: 壁に貼る - "stick to wall" 部屋に入る - "enter room"

children.heading: Emphasizing direction/path
children.content: 北へ向かう - "head north" 前へ進む - "advance forward"

children.heading: Abstract/symbolic direction
children.content: 未来へ - "toward the future" 夢へ - "toward dreams"

children.heading: Existence location
children.content: ✓ 部屋にいる - "be in room" ✗ 部屋へいる

children.heading: Time
children.content: ✓ 三時に - "at 3 o'clock" ✗ 三時へ

children.heading: Indirect object
children.content: ✓ 友達に手紙を書く - "write to friend" ✗ 友達へ手紙を書く (less common)

sections.heading: Comparison Chart
sections.content: | Use | に | へ | | --------------- | --- | --- | | Destination | ✓ | ✓ | | Direction/path | △ | ✓ | | Specific point | ✓ | △ | | Existence | ✓ | ✗ | | Time | ✓ | ✗ | | Indirect object | ✓ | △ |

sections.heading: Nuance Difference
sections.content:
手紙を母に送る "send letter to mother" (recipient focus) 手紙を母へ送る "send letter toward mother" (direction focus)

Both correct, に more common in speech.

sections.heading: Common Verbs
sections.content: | Verb | Prefers | Example | | ------ | ------- | ------------- | | 行く | Both | 学校に/へ行く | | 来る | Both | 日本に/へ来る | | 帰る | に | 家に帰る | | 着く | に | 駅に着く | | 向かう | へ | 北へ向かう | | 進む | へ | 前へ進む |

sections.heading: Regional Preferences
sections.content:
Some regions prefer one over the other:

Standard: 学校に行く Some dialects: 学校へ行く (more common)

Both are correct nationwide.

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Mostly interchangeable for destination ✓ に for specific points ✓ へ for direction/path ✓ に more common in daily speech ✓ へ slightly more formal/literary

Related:

に (ni) - Location/Direction へ (e) - Direction で (de) - Location
